page.title: 02PORKELLIS Cornwall - Housing
page.content: There are only three small villages in this area; PORKELLIS, Carnkie and Penmarth, each with a population of only a few hundreds. Due to a higher than national average of unemployment these populations are in decline as the young move away to find work. Housing is therefore confined to traditional granite faced houses and cottages, and a few bungalows built in the 1950's and 1960's. There is a small council estate at Carnmenellis of half a dozen homes.The rest of the area being farm land the housing consists of traditional granite built farmhouses.
